channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Misinformation about fentanyl exposure threatens to undermine overdose response
item.description: Fentanyl overdoses occur from ingesting the synthetic opioid. But popular culture has misrepresented the risks to first responders.

item.title: HHS guts the teams that fulfill public records requests for health agencies
item.description: Despite promises for 'radical transparency,' HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. laid off many staff on teams that fulfill public records requests at...

item.title: Tariffs are another reason why Americans feel so lousy about the economy
item.description: As President Trump opens a new front in his trade war, U.S. consumers are feeling shaky about the economy. And that's beginning to weigh on their spen...

item.title: World markets respond to Trump's new tariffs. And, TikTok nears its sell-by date
item.description: Trump announced new tariffs on goods from all countries yesterday. Economists are worried about the domestic and worldwide impact this could cause. An...

item.title: Markets in Asia and Europe fall following U.S. announcement of global tariffs
item.description: Shares tumbled in Europe and Asia and U.S. futures tumbled Thursday following U.S. President Donald Trump 's announcement of big increases in tariffs ...

item.title: How other nations are reacting to Trump's sweeping new tariffs
item.description: America's global trading partners are bristling at President Trump's tariff tactics, but many also stress a desire to strike new deals with the U.S.

item.title: Violent storms cut through the South and Midwest, spawning tornadoes and killing 3
item.description: Violent storms have cut through a wide swath of the South and Midwest, spawning tornadoes and killing at least three people.

item.title: Mayor resigns after texting sexually explicit video to city attorney
item.description: Minot Mayor Tom Ross sent the lewd video minutes after he and the city attorney had a phone call discussing a police officer's suicide.

item.title: World leaders criticise Trump tariffs as 'major blow'
item.description: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen says US tariffs will see "uncertainty spiral" as world leaders react to Trump's announcement.

item.title: Deaths of British couple in France treated as murder-suicide
item.description: The bodies of Andrew and Dawn Searle, who previously lived in East Lothian, were found at their home near Toulouse.

item.title: Tufts declares support for student detained by ICE, seeks immediate release
item.description: Tufts University is seeking the release of international graduate student Rumeysa Ozturk, who was taken into custody by federal agents.

item.title: UK set to host 2035 Women's World Cup as only 'valid' bid
item.description: The UK is set to host the 2035 Women's World Cup as the sole "valid" bidder for the tournament, Fifa president Gianni Infantino says.

item.title: Judge in Boston to hold hearing on detained Tufts Ph.D. student
item.description: ICE agents took Turkish Ph.D. student Rumeysa Ozturk into custody near Tufts, revoked her visa and moved her to a detention center in Louisiana last w...

item.title: Myanmar leader heads to Bangkok as quake deaths climb to 3,000
item.description: Min Aung Hlaing is scheduled to attend a summit of the seven countries that border the Bay of Bengal.

item.title: 3/30/2025: Hostages; Voice of America; Left Behind
item.description: First, freed Israeli hostage Yarden Bibas speaks out. Then, a report on what Trump's silencing of Voice of America means for listeners worldwide. And,...

item.title: Court gives Drake access to Kendrick's contracts
item.description: The star requested access to the sensitive documents in his defamation lawsuit over Not Like Us.

item.title: Judge dismisses corruption case against New York City Mayor Eric Adams
This is what forecasters mean when they talk about a 100-year flood
